meanings.definition: The act of cutting out or removing something.
meanings.sent1: The excisions of the damaged part were necessary for the plant's growth.
meanings.sent2: The doctor performed excisions to remove the tumor from the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The excisions of the weeds made the garden look neat and tidy.
meanings.sent4: Her excisions of negativity from her life brought her peace and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The excisions of the old wallpaper revealed a beautiful, hidden mural underneath.

meanings.definition: The surgical removal of tissue from a person's body.
meanings.sent1: The excisions during the surgery were successful in removing the tumor.
meanings.sent2: After the excisions, the patient needed time to recover from the procedure.
meanings.sent3: The excisions performed by the skilled surgeon saved the patient's life.
meanings.sent4: His excisions of the infected tissue prevented the spread of the disease.
meanings.sent5: The excisions of the damaged skin allowed for proper healing to take place.

meanings.definition: The process of editing or deleting parts of a written work.
meanings.sent1: The excisions of unnecessary paragraphs improved the clarity of the essay.
meanings.sent2: The editor suggested excisions to tighten up the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: Her excisions of cliches made the story more engaging to read.
meanings.sent4: The excisions of redundant information made the report more concise.
meanings.sent5: The excisions of irrelevant details sharpened the focus of the article.
